newsitem.title: JAPAN: Chiyoda to move headquarters, cut staff.
newsitem.headline: Chiyoda to move headquarters, cut staff.

text.p: Major Japanese engineering company Chiyoda Corp said on Tuesday it plans several restructuring measures, including moving its headquarters and introducing an early retirement programme.
A company spokesman said its headquarters will be moved from a rented building in Tokyo to a company building in Yokohama.
It will also implement an early retirement programme for employees aged 50 and older.
The Japanese business daily Nihon Keizai Shimbun reported on Tuesday that the company hopes to reduce its work force to 2,500 from the current 3,000 by March 1999.
But the spokesman declined to say how far its work force would be reduced as a result of the early retirement programme.
The company also plans to close its offices in Mexico and Bahrain, the spokesman said.
It has said it expects to post a parent current loss of 46 billion yen for the year that ended on March 31.
